content.description: Bankers at a large financial institution created the linear regression model <math alttext="d hat equals, 0.37 minus 0.0004 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0.37</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.0004</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to predict the proportion of customers who would default on their loans, <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, based on the customer’s credit score, <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: For a customer with a credit score of 700, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The default proportion is predicted to be 0.09.
The default proportion is predicted to be approximately 1.75 million.
The default proportion will be approximately 1.75 million.
The default proportion is predicted to be 0.28.

content.answer: The default proportion is predicted to be 0.09.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
